p: POCT has the advantages of rapid results, unrestricted test sites and low professional skill requirements for operators ( 89). Therefore, the research and development of POCT nucleic acid detection technology is likely to be the general direction of future development of testing. Operators only need to add samples, such as swabs or blood, into the slot on ‘sample in-result out’ requirement, which will significantly simplify the detection process ( 90, 91). POCT automatically completes nucleic acid amplification, signal collection and result analysis in a short time ( 90). However, POCT requires improvement due to lack of authoritative control experiments and lack of uniform national standards for manufactured products ( 91).
